page.title: 01NAIRN AND SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: The area which we have been given to survey for{The Domesday Project} contains the eastern half of a town with a {population}of{7725},called { {Nairn.} The town is on the coast.The firth to the north of the town is the{Moray {Firth.}The {River Nairn}passes through our D-Block.In the eastern half of our block we have part of a village called {Auldearn.}About three quarters of our D-Block consists of farm land.In the north east corner of our block there is part of a forestry plantation of the{Culbin Forest. { }On the east side of the pier there is the{Dunbar Golf Course},which runs parallel to a caravan park and a stretch of marram covered sand dunes and tidal coastline.Traversing our block is the A96 road and the Aberdeen-Inverness railway.
